DataElement.preferredName: Lymphoma Leptomeninges Cerebrospinal Fluid Cancer Progression Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator for information related to a pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes involving the fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord and/or the leptomeninges, the two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord, the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lymphoma Cerebrospinal Fluid Leptomeninges Cancer Progression
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes involving the fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord and/or the leptomeninges, the two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord, the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites.  This category includes Non-Hodgkin's lymphomas and Hodgkin's lymphomas. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: (seh-REE-broe-SPY-nal) The fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord. Cerebrospinal fluid is produced in the ventricles in the brain.:The two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord, the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.:A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.
The two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord, the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
